info.name: Mercado Pago Developers
info.description:
## Overview

This collection includes the APIs needed to implement Mercado Pago's main products.

Each folder contains a complete list of API resources needed to implement each particular product (Checkout Pro, Checkout API, In store payments, etc).

## Prerequisites

You will need an account (live or test) to access your credentiales to make API calls.

Make sure to create your account and access your credentials following this [guide](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-api/additional-content/your-integrations/credentials).

## How to use it

Visit our [developer's site](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en) and check the full documentation for the product you want to implement in order to get the foundations needed to use this collection.

Get your credentials ready and fork the "Integration" environment. Set the variables you need (Public Key, Access Token, etc.) for the specific product you want to test. Fork the collection and start testing our APIs

> **IMPORTANT**: fork it in a **PRIVATE** workspace. Your credentials and sensitive information must stay private at all times. If you think your credentials may have been exposed, to refresh them. 
  

## Extra resources

- Check out our [Developer's site](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en)
    
- See our [API Reference](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/reference) for a full resource list

item.description:
In Checkout Pro you will use the Payments API to obtain the full details of the transaction (status, payment method, charged details, etc.)

The payment ID will be received through server-to-server notifications, or via the Merchant Order.

item.description:
The merchant order is created when the payer selects to pay inside a Checkout Pro. It's an abstraction of an order and a checkout flow.

Makes it easier to keep track of payment intents inside a checkout flow (ie. a rejection and a second approved transaction) and checkouts completed with multiple payment methods (ie. two credit cards).

You will know the merchant order ID from a server-to-server notification.

item.description:
A refund can happen when a charge has been made to the customer, meaning there is an approved payment.

Cancellations happen when a purchase is made, but the payments has not yet been approved (payments status _pendind_ or _in_process_)

item.description: How to manage chargebacks. You will know the chargeback id from a server-to-server notification about the chargeback, or via the payment (from a change of status).

Manage your payments. Make a total or partial refund, cancel a pre authorized payment or manage a chargeback.

There may be restrictions to partial refunds depending on site of operation or payment method.

item.name: Marketplace model

request.description: Create a preference with Marketplace model. Gives the ability to charge a _marketplace_fee_

item.description:
The Split payments solution is designed to provide Payment Service Provider (PSP) services to sellers in marketplace models. Marketplaces are e-commerce platforms that connect sellers and buyers, offering a unified environment for online sales, expanding reach, and conversion.

The API call is made with an access token obtained through the Oauth process. The variable _seller_access_token_ represents this particular access token. For more information refer to the [Split Payments documentation](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/split-payments/landing)

Requires the implementation of Oauth

In this folder you will find all the API calls needed to integrate Mercado Pago's Checkout Pro.

Make sure to:

1. Read the [testing](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-pro/integration-test/test-purchase) documentation
    
2. [Create a test user](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-pro/additional-content/your-integrations/test/accounts) and get the [credentials](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-pro/additional-content/your-integrations/credentials)
    
3. Select the Environment "Integration"
    
4. Set the access token of the test user created as the value for access_token
    

You may to need to set collection variables as you go to test all resources (preference id, payment id, merchant order id)

item.description:
Create payments with cards (credit, debit, prepaid). There is multiple examples for different industries and categories. All the payer and Items information is used for fraud prevention reasons, make sure to send it as detailes as possible.

An Idempotency Key (sent as header) is required when creating or updating a payment. In this collection the header is automatically generated.

You can also search payments with their corresponding ID or External Reference.

request.description:
Create an authorized payment. If the payment is authorized, the funds will be pre-approved and a later action to capture the funds is necessary.  
Remember to add the payment details and the payer's information.

item.description:
The merchant order is created when the payer selects to pay inside a Checkout Pro. It's an abstraction of an order and a checkout flow.

Makes it easier to keep track of payment intents inside a checkout flow (ie. a rejection and a second approved transaction) and checkouts completed with multiple payment methods (ie. two credit cards).

You will know the merchant order ID from a server-to-server notification.

In this folder you will find all the API calls needed to integrate Mercado Pago's Checkout Pro with Checkout Bricks.

You may to need to set collection variables as you go to test all resources (preference id, payment id, merchant order id)

item.description:
A customer represents a user of your service / application.

It is mandatory to create a customer to add saved cards.

> **IMPORTANT**: The customer is associated only to the application (account) that generated it, meaning it is encapsulated for a specific integration. It does not hold any ties to a customer of Mercado Pago or other integrations.

Represents a saved card in Mercado Pago's PCI vault. Must always be related to a customer ID.

API's allow for full management of cards (add, get, delete, update).

> IMPORTANT: Your integration will only have access to the cards collected in your application and created with your credentials.

item.name: Zero Dollar Auth

request.description: Validate a card with a zero value transaction (for a previously saved customer)
Validate a card with a zero value transaction (with an email)

item.description:
ZDA allows you to validate a credit or debit card withouth making effective charges to the client. This eliminates the the need to make a trial charge and refunds, improving overall customer experience.

Make sure to read the [documentation](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/zero-dollar-auth/landing).

Available for Visa and Mastercard credit and debit cards, only in Argentina, Brazil and Chile.

Create Customers and associate Cards to them. All information will be safely stored in Mercado Pago's PCI vault.  
With this integration you can show saved cards on your site for a better checkout experience.

item.description:
A refund can happen when a charge has been made to the customer, meaning there is an approved payment.

Cancellations happen when a purchase is made, but the payments has not yet been approved (payments status _pendind_ or _in_process_)

item.name: Chargebacks

request.description: Check all the information related to a chargeback for your product or service with the ID of the chargeback.
Submit documentation for a chargeback dispute.

item.description: How to manage chargebacks. You will know the chargeback id from a server-to-server notification about the chargeback, or via the payment (from a change of status).

Manage your payments. Make a total or partial refund, cancel a pre authorized payment or manage a chargeback.

There may be restrictions to partial refunds depending on site of operation or payment method.

item.name: Marketplace model

request.description: Create a preference for Checkout Pro implementation, adding a marketplace fee to the transaction.

header.description: (Required) A unique key that the server uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

request.description: Create a payment using maketplace model, allowing a marketplace fee (application fee) in the transaction

item.description:
The Split payments solution is designed to provide Payment Service Provider (PSP) services to sellers in marketplace models. Marketplaces are e-commerce platforms that connect sellers and buyers, offering a unified environment for online sales, expanding reach, and conversion.

The API call is made with an access token obtained through the Oauth process. The variable _seller_access_token_ represents this particular access token. For more information refer to the [Split Payments documentation](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/split-payments/landing)

Requires the implementation of Oauth

Checkout Bricks is a set of UI modules that come front-end ready and optimized for better usability and conversion. Each Brick can be used independently or together, forming the experience of a complete checkout.  
Nevertheless, you will need to interact with Mercado Pago services in your backend. Here you can find the different API's needed to implement Checkout Bricks.

Make sure to:

1. Read the [testing](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-api/integration-test/make-test-purchase) documentation
    
2. Create an account and get the testing [credentials](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-pro/additional-content/your-integrations/credentials)
    
3. Select the Environment "Integration"
    
4. Set the "public_key" and "access_token" variables with the test credentials
    

You may to need to set collection variables as you go to test all resources (payment id, customer id, card id, etc.)

item.description:
Create payments with cards (credit, debit, prepaid), and other payment methods. There is multiple examples for different industries and categories. All the payer and Items information is used for fraud prevention reasons, make sure to send it as detailes as possible.

An Idempotency Key (sent as header) is required when creating or updating a payment. In this collection the header is automatically generated.

You can also search payments with their corresponding ID or External Reference.

item.name: Payments (auth + capture)

header.description: (Required) A unique key that the server uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

request.description:
Create an authorized payment. If the payment is authorized, the funds will be pre-approved and a later action to capture the funds is necessary.  
Remember to add the payment details and the payer's information.

item.description:
Create an authorization for a payment and late capture the full or a partial amount.

Available for credit cards.

Availability of this feature may vary depending on operation site.

item.name: Customers & Cards
Customers

request.description: Create a customer with all its data and save the cards used to simplify the payment process.

response.name: Create Customer

request.description: Check all the information of a client created with the client ID of your choice.

response.name: Get Customer

request.description: Find all customer information using the email filter.

response.name: Get Customer by Email

request.description: Renew the data of a customer. Indicate the customer ID and send the parameters with the information you want to update.

response.name: Update Customer

item.description:
A customer represents a user of your service / application.

It is mandatory to create a customer to add saved cards.

> **IMPORTANT**: The customer is associated only to the application (account) that generated it, meaning it is encapsulated for a specific integration. It does not hold any ties to a customer of Mercado Pago or other integrations.

item.name: Cards

request.description: Securely store on our servers the card reference used by the customer in the payment to avoid asking for all the data in future transactions.

response.name: Add Credit Card

request.description: Check the reference information for a saved card associated with a customer.

response.name: Get Customer Card

request.description: Delete the data of a card associated with a customer whenever you need to.

response.name: Delete Customer Card

request.description: Consult a client's saved cards in order to be able to show them when making a payment.

response.name: Get All Customer Cards

request.description: Renew the details of a card associated with a customer. Indicate the IDs and send the parameters with the information you want to update.

response.name: Update Customer Card

item.description:
Represents a saved card in Mercado Pago's PCI vault. Must always be related to a customer ID.

API's allow for full management of cards (add, get, delete, update).

> IMPORTANT: Your integration will only have access to the cards collected in your application and created with your credentials.

item.description: Create a payment with a saved card / customer. The customer id must be sent when creating a payment with a saved card.

item.name: Zero Dollar Auth

request.description: Validate a card with a zero value transaction (for a previously saved customer)
Validate a card with a zero value transaction (with an email)

item.description:
ZDA allows you to validate a credit or debit card withouth making effective charges to the client. This eliminates the the need to make a trial charge and refunds, improving overall customer experience.

Make sure to read the [documentation](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/zero-dollar-auth/landing).

Available for Visa and Mastercard credit and debit cards, only in Argentina, Brazil and Chile.

Create Customers and associate Cards to them. All information will be safely stored in Mercado Pago's PCI vault.  
With this integration you can show saved cards on your site for a better checkout experience.

Cancellations happen when a purchase is made, but the payments has not yet been approved (payments status _pendind_ or _in_process_)

Manage your payments. Make a total or partial refund, cancel a pre authorized payment or manage a chargeback.

There may be restrictions to partial refunds depending on site of operation or payment method.

item.description:
The Split payments solution is designed to provide Payment Service Provider (PSP) services to sellers in marketplace models. Marketplaces are e-commerce platforms that connect sellers and buyers, offering a unified environment for online sales, expanding reach, and conversion.

The API call is made with an access token obtained through the Oauth process. The variable_seller_access_token_represents this particular access token. For more information refer to the[Split Payments documentation](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/split-payments/landing)

Requires the implementation of Oauth

Mercado Pago's Transparent Checkout (or Checkout API) allows the entire checkout process, from filling in user data to making the payment, to take place in a single environment, without the need to redirect to a page outside your store.

For a full documentation, refer to our [Developer's Site](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-api/landing).

Make sure to:

1. Read the [testing](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-api/integration-test/make-test-purchase) documentation
    
2. Create an account and get the testing [credentials](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-pro/additional-content/your-integrations/credentials)
    
3. Select the Environment "Integration"
    
4. Set the "public_key" and "access_token" variables with the test credentials
    

You may to need to set collection variables as you go to test all resources (payment id, customer id, card id, etc.)

You will know the merchant order ID from a server-to-server notification.

item.description:
A payment is an entity that represents a charge made to a specific payment method. It contains the full information about the transaction, and is needed in case of refunds.

An order can have one or more payments associated to it.

API calls to implement Attended QR for Mercado Pago's instore solution

Make sure to:

1. Read the [testing documentation](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/qr-code/pre-requisites)
    
2. Create an account and get the [testing credentials](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/qr-code/additional-content/your-integrations/credentials)
    
3. Select the Environment "Integration"
    
4. Set the "public_key" and "access_token" variables with the test credentials
    

You may need to set collection variables as you go (pos_id, external_pos_id, store_id, etc.) to test all the services.

item.description:
The merchant order is an abstraction of an order and a payment flow. It is tied to the external reference sent when creating the order for reconcilliation purposes.

Allows your integration to know when an order has been paid in full to continue the sale process.

You will know the merchant order ID from a server-to-server notification.

A payment is an entity that represents a charge made to a specific payment method. It contains the full information about the transaction, and is needed in case of refunds.

An order can have one or more payments associated to it.

All the necessary API calls to integrate Dynamic QR

Make sure to:

1. Read the [testing documentation](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/qr-code/pre-requisites)
    
2. Create an account and get the [testing credentials](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/qr-code/additional-content/your-integrations/credentials)
    
3. Select the Environment "Integration"
    
4. Set the "public_key" and "access_token" variables with the test credentials
    

You may need to set collection variables as you go (pos_id, external_pos_id, store_id, etc.) to test all the services.

(Required) Temporal grant received in the redirect url in an Oauth process
(Required) Application ID of the Oauth recepient

request.description: To create the necessary token to operate your application in the name of a seller.

urlencoded.description: (Required) Refresh token associated with an Oauth vinculation

request.description: To refresh the necessary token to operate your application in the name of a seller.

item.description:
OAuth is an authorization protocol that allows applications to have limited access to the private information of Mercado Pago accounts, through the HTTP protocol that introduces an authentication and authorization layer in which you request access to the protected resources of sellers, through an access token limited to a particular application, without the need for the credentials of the sellers through the access flows.

You can create [test users](https://www.mercadopago.com.ar/developers/en/docs/checkout-pro/additional-content/your-integrations/test/accounts) to try the complete flow.
